title: Pho Bo (Beef Noodle Soup)
ingredients: Bean sprouts, Thai basil, lime wedges, chili for serving
steps: Parboil the beef bones in boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain and rinse to remove impurities. This ensures a clear broth.
Char the onions and ginger directly over a gas flame or under a broiler until blackened on all sides, about 5 minutes. This adds depth to the broth.
Toast star anise, cinnamon, cloves, and coriander seeds in a dry pan over medium heat for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
In a large pot, add the cleaned bones, beef brisket, charred onions and ginger, and toasted spices. Cover with 4 liters of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer.
Skim off any foam that rises to the surface for the first 30 minutes. Simmer uncovered for 3 hours, adding water if needed to keep bones covered.
Remove the brisket after 1.5 hours when tender. Let cool, then slice thinly against the grain. Continue simmering the broth.
Strain the broth through a fine-mesh sieve. Season with fish sauce and sugar. Taste and adjust - the broth should be savory, slightly sweet, and aromatic.
Cook fresh rice noodles according to package instructions (usually 1-2 minutes in boiling water). Drain and divide among bowls.
Top noodles with sliced cooked brisket and raw beef sirloin slices. Ladle the piping hot broth over - it will cook the raw beef.

Serve immediately with a plate of bean sprouts, Thai basil, lime wedges, sliced chilies, hoisin sauce, and Sriracha. Diners add these to taste. The broth should be clear, fragrant, and deeply flavorful.

title: Banh Mi (Vietnamese Sandwich)
steps: Make the pickles: Mix rice vinegar, sugar, and a pinch of salt until sugar dissolves. Add julienned carrot and daikon. Let sit for at least 30 minutes.
Marinate the pork: Combine soy sauce, fish sauce, minced garlic, and sugar. Add sliced pork and marinate for 15 minutes.
Heat a skillet over high heat. Cook the marinated pork for 3-4 minutes per side until caramelized and cooked through.
Slice the baguettes lengthwise, leaving one side attached. Lightly toast if desired.
Spread mayonnaise on one side and pâté on the other (optional but traditional).
Layer with cooked pork, drained pickled vegetables, cucumber slices, jalapeño slices, and fresh cilantro.
Serve immediately. The banh mi should have a crispy crust, soft interior, and a perfect balance of savory, sweet, sour, and spicy flavors.

title: Fresh Spring Rolls (Goi Cuon)
ingredients: For peanut sauce: 3 tbsp Peanut butter
steps: Make the peanut sauce: Mix peanut butter, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, and Sriracha. Add water gradually until you reach a dipping consistency. Set aside.
Prepare all ingredients and arrange on a plate for easy assembly.
Fill a large shallow dish with warm water. Dip one rice paper wrapper for 2-3 seconds until just softened (it will continue to soften). Lay flat on a clean surface.
On the bottom third of the wrapper, layer lettuce, vermicelli, mint, cilantro, and basil.
Fold the bottom edge over the filling, then fold in the sides. Place 2-3 shrimp halves cut-side down on top (they'll be visible through the wrapper).
Roll tightly to the top. The wrapper should be translucent, showing the colorful ingredients inside.
Repeat with remaining wrappers and ingredients. Serve immediately with peanut sauce. The rolls should be fresh, light, and bursting with herbs.

title: Bun Cha (Grilled Pork with Noodles)
ingredients: For dipping sauce: 1/2 cup Fish sauce
steps: Mix ground pork with 2 tablespoons fish sauce, 1 tablespoon sugar, minced garlic, shallots, and black pepper. Form into small patties. Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Marinate pork belly slices with 1 tablespoon fish sauce, 1 tablespoon sugar, and black pepper for 1 hour.
Make the dipping sauce: Dissolve sugar in warm water. Add fish sauce, lime juice, minced garlic, and sliced chili. Adjust to taste - it should be sweet, salty, sour, and spicy.
Grill the pork patties and pork belly slices over high heat (or broil) for 3-4 minutes per side until charred and caramelized.
Cook rice vermicelli according to package instructions. Drain and rinse with cold water.
Serve in bowls: Place vermicelli in individual bowls. Add grilled pork patties and belly slices. Pour dipping sauce over or serve on the side.
Accompany with fresh herbs (mint, cilantro, perilla), lettuce, and pickled vegetables. Diners mix everything together. The dish should be smoky, sweet, and refreshing.

title: Vietnamese Iced Coffee (Ca Phe Sua Da)
steps: Add 2 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk to a glass.
Place a Vietnamese coffee filter (phin) on top of the glass. Add 3 tablespoons ground coffee to the filter.
Gently press down the filter insert to compress the coffee slightly - not too tight or water won't drip through.
Pour a small amount of boiling water (about 2 tablespoons) over the coffee to bloom it. Wait 30 seconds.
Fill the filter with boiling water to the top. Cover with the lid and let it drip slowly - this should take 4-5 minutes. The slow drip is essential for the strong, rich flavor.
Once all the water has dripped through, remove the filter. Stir the coffee and condensed milk together well.
Fill a separate glass with ice cubes. Pour the coffee mixture over the ice.
Serve immediately. Vietnamese iced coffee should be strong, sweet, and incredibly smooth with a beautiful caramel color.
